item.title: HELP please
item.dc:creator: @Potzon Potzon
item.description:
@Potzon wrote:

This is my code for ::commands

if(cmd[0].equals("commands")) { player.getActionSender().sendInterface(275, false); for(int i = 0; i < 316; i++) { player.getActionSender().sendString("",275,i); } player.getActionSender().sendString("SERVER NAME HERE", 275, 2); player.getActionSender().sendString("* Commands *", 275, 16); player.getActionSender().sendString("::COMMAND", 275, 17); player.getActionSender().sendString("::COMMAND", 275, 18); player.getActionSender().sendString("::COMMAND", 275, 19); player.getActionSender().sendString("::COMMAND", 275, 20); player.getActionSender().sendString("::COMMAND", 275, 21); player.getActionSender().sendString("", 275, 22); player.getActionSender().sendString("* Monster Teleports *", 275, 23); player.getActionSender().sendString("::COMMAND", 275, 24); player.getActionSender().sendString("::COMMAND", 275, 25); player.getActionSender().sendString("::COMMAND", 275, 26); player.getActionSender().sendString("::COMMAND", 275, 27); }
Paste this code somewhere in your command packethandler, IDK what your command packethandler is called.
And change “::COMMAND” to the command you want.
Now I guess you can edit more command yourself.

Read full topic
